1   Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said: 2 How long will ye lay snares for words? Consider, and afterwards we will speak. 3 Wherefore are we counted as beasts, and reputed dull in your sight? 4 Thou that tearest thyself in thine anger, shall the earth be forsaken for thee? Or shall the rock be removed out of its place? 5 Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of her fire shall not shine. 6 The light shall be dark in her tent, and her lamp over her shall be put out. 7 The steps of her strength shall be straitened, and her own counsel shall cast her down. 8 For she is cast into a net by her own feet, and she walketh upon the toils. 9 A gin shall take her by the heel, and a snare shall lay hold on her. 10 A noose is hid for her in the ground, and a trap for her in the way.
11 Terrors shall overwhelm her on every side, and shall entrap her at her feet. 12 Her trouble shall be ravenous, and calamity shall be ready for her fall. 13 It shall devour the members of her body, yea, the first-born of death shall devour her members. 14 That wherein she trusteth shall be plucked out of her tent; and she shall be brought to the queen of terrors. 15 There shall dwell in her tent that which is none of her; brimstone shall be scattered upon her habitation. 16 Her roots shall dry up beneath, and above shall her branch wither. 17 Her remembrance shall perish from the earth, and she shall have no name abroad. 18 She shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world. 19 She shall have neither daughter nor daughter's daughter among her people, nor any remaining in her dwellings. 20 They that come after shall be astonished at her day, as they that went before are affrighted.
